DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: select SUM(c.Count) from ( select count(*) AS Count from VirusEvents where AlertTime >= ? union select count(*) AS Count from PUAEvents where AlertTime >= ?) c
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: select top QUERY_LIMIT AlertTime, c.Name, InfectedItem, ItemName, OutStanding, SubType, CleanUpable, ActionTaken, VirusType, ScannerType, TNSType from ( select ve.AlertTime AS AlertTime, v.ComputerID AS ComputerID, v.InfectedItem AS InfectedItem, v.VirusName AS ItemName, v.OutStanding AS OutStanding, v.SubType AS SubType, v.CleanUpable AS CleanUpable, ve.ActionTaken AS ActionTaken, ve.VirusType AS VirusType, ve.ScannerType AS ScannerType, 'Virus' AS TNSType from Viruses v left join VirusEvents ve on ve.AlertId = v.ID where ve.AlertTime >= ? union select pe.AlertTime AS AlertTime, p.ComputerID AS ComputerID, p.InfectedItem AS InfectedItem, p.PUAName AS ItemName, p.OutStanding AS OutStanding, p.SubType AS SubType, p.CleanUpable AS CleanUpable, pe.ActionTaken AS ActionTaken, pe.DetectionType AS VirusType, pe.ScannerType AS ScannerType, 'PUA' AS TNSType from PUAs p left join PUAEvents pe on pe.AlertId = p.ID where pe.AlertTime >= ?) t left join ComputersAndDeletedComputers c on t.ComputerID = c.ID order by AlertTime

string.toolTipText:
Amount of rows to attempt to pull in one query, recommended 10000. This value should be
larger than the expected peak value of events that will be received in one second,
but not so large as to cause the reader to run out of memory.
Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)

DefaultReaderConfiguration.preQueryCheck: select count(*) from ThreatEvents where AlertTime >= ?
DefaultReaderConfiguration.queryString: SELECT TOP QUERY_LIMIT te.AlertTime, c.Name, t.FullFilePath AS InfectedItem, t.ThreatName AS ItemName, t.OutStanding, '2' AS SubType, t.Cleanupable AS CleanUpable, te.ActionTaken, '300' AS VirusType, te.ScannerType, t.ThreatType AS TNSType FROM Threats t, ThreatEvents te, ComputersAndDeletedComputers c WHERE te.AlertTime >= ? AND te.ThreatInstanceID = t.ThreatInstanceID AND t.ComputerID = c.ID ORDER BY te.AlertTime

string.toolTipText:
Amount of rows to attempt to pull in one query, recommended 10000. This value should be
larger than the expected peak value of events that will be received in one second,
but not so large as to cause the reader to run out of memory.
Hostname of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

integer.toolTipText: Port number of the nDepth appliance to receive log data

select.toolTipText: Data routing (normalized alerts to Manager and/or raw data to nDepth)
